articles.headline: In China Trade War, Apple Worries It Will Be Collateral Damage
articles.snippet: Caught in the trade fight between Washington and Beijing, Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, has become something of an envoy while trying to protect the company’s business in China.
articles.abstract: Caught in the trade fight between Washington and Beijing, Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, has become something of an envoy while trying to protect the company’s business in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple’s chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, may be the leader of the world’s most valuable public company, but lately he has had to act a lot like the tech industry’s top diplomat.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas and Paul Mozur

articles.headline: Los Angeles Times, Searching for Stability, Names Norman Pearlstine Top Editor
articles.snippet: Mr. Pearlstine, a veteran of Time Inc., Bloomberg and The Wall Street Journal, was appointed by Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong, who took ownership of the paper on Monday.
articles.abstract: Mr. Pearlstine, a veteran of Time Inc., Bloomberg and The Wall Street Journal, was appointed by Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong, who took ownership of the paper on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — On his first day as the owner of The Los Angeles Times, the billionaire biotech executive Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong, hoping to bring stability to a newsroom bruised in recent years by steep staffing cuts and tumultuous leadership changes, named Norman Pearlstine as the newspaper’s top editor.

articles.headline: Financial World’s A-List Could Take Hollywood’s Cue on Inclusion
articles.snippet: To promote diversity, big pension funds and college endowments could insist on equitable hiring practices at investment firms.
articles.abstract: To promote diversity, big pension funds and college endowments could insist on equitable hiring practices at investment firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: Frances McDormand, the actress who won an Academy Award this year for her performance in “Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri,” introduced much of the world to a new idea when she accepted her Oscar.

articles.headline: Trump Threatens Tariffs on $200 Billion in China Goods, Escalating Fight
articles.snippet: President Trump’s threat was the latest volley in a dizzying trade dispute that has pitted the world’s two largest economies against each other.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s threat was the latest volley in a dizzying trade dispute that has pitted the world’s two largest economies against each other.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump further escalated his trade fight with China on Monday, saying his administration was prepared to impose tariffs on another $200 billion worth of Chinese goods and potentially even more if Beijing continues to fight back.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson, Keith Bradsher and Katie Rogers

articles.headline: How Anti-Immigration Passion Was Inflamed From the Fringe
articles.snippet: Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller once shouted from the sidelines. Now they’re the driving force behind the policy separating immigrant children from parents.
articles.abstract: Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller once shouted from the sidelines. Now they’re the driving force behind the policy separating immigrant children from parents.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller spent years on the political fringe in the nation’s capital as high-decibel immigration hard-liners, always warning about the dangers of open borders but rarely in a position to affect law or policy.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Katie Benner

articles.headline: Mexico’s World Cup Captain Is on a U.S. Blacklist
articles.snippet: Rafael Marquez is at his fifth World Cup. But Treasury Department sanctions over what it says are ties to a drug trafficker have scared off sponsors and made for some careful planning.
articles.abstract: Rafael Marquez is at his fifth World Cup. But Treasury Department sanctions over what it says are ties to a drug trafficker have scared off sponsors and made for some careful planning.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Rafael Márquez, one of the best-known stars on Mexico’s World Cup soccer team, is a standout of the tournament in Russia. But it has nothing to do with his prowess on the field.

articles.headline: Swift Frontier Justice for Migrants Brought to Federal Courts
articles.snippet: President Trump’s new policy requiring criminal prosecutions of migrants who illegally cross the border is flooding the court system with a new kind of defendant.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s new policy requiring criminal prosecutions of migrants who illegally cross the border is flooding the court system with a new kind of defendant.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON, Ariz. — They filed into the room seven by seven for a dose of rapid-fire justice: In less than a minute and in quick succession, each migrant pleaded guilty to illegally entering the United States, and was sentenced.
